main event: On 15 Oct 59, observers at Dover AFB spotted a white fireball with a tail changing color from white to blue and blue-green.
interesting points: The fireball was observed for 14 seconds at dusk under clear conditions with good visibility., The tail was measured at approximately one to one and one-fourth inches long using a pea at arm's length., The object was reported by the tower chief and another controller at the control tower., The reported trajectory was horizontal and parallel with the horizon., A similar object was reported by a radar station at Patuxent at the same time.
witness description: T/SGT William C. Carn, Jr. with 8 years of experience, and A/2C John D. Olive with 3 months of experience.
